steps.name: validate-incident
steps.command:
echo "🔍 VALIDATING INCIDENT PARAMETERS"
echo "================================="
VALIDATION_PASSED=true
MISSING_PARAMS=""

if [ -z "${incident_id}" ]; then
  echo "❌ ERROR: incident_id is required"
  VALIDATION_PASSED=false
  MISSING_PARAMS="${MISSING_PARAMS} incident_id"
fi

if [ -z "${incident_title}" ]; then
  echo "❌ ERROR: incident_title is required"
  VALIDATION_PASSED=false
  MISSING_PARAMS="${MISSING_PARAMS} incident_title"
fi

if [ -z "${incident_severity}" ]; then
  echo "❌ ERROR: incident_severity is required"
  VALIDATION_PASSED=false
  MISSING_PARAMS="${MISSING_PARAMS} incident_severity"
fi

if [ -z "${affected_services}" ]; then
  echo "⚠️ WARNING: affected_services not provided - will create validation agent"
fi

case "${incident_severity}" in
  "critical"|"high"|"medium"|"low")
    echo "✅ Severity ${incident_severity} is valid"
    ;;
  *)
    echo "❌ ERROR: Invalid severity ${incident_severity}. Must be: critical, high, medium, or low"
    VALIDATION_PASSED=false
    MISSING_PARAMS="${MISSING_PARAMS} valid_severity"
    ;;
esac

if [ "$VALIDATION_PASSED" = "true" ]; then
  echo "📋 INCIDENT METADATA:"
  echo "  ID: ${incident_id}"
  echo "  Title: ${incident_title}"
  echo "  Severity: ${incident_severity}"
  echo "  Priority: ${incident_priority}"
  echo "  Owner: ${incident_owner}"
  echo "  Source: ${incident_source}"
  echo "  Affected Services: ${affected_services:-TBD via agent}"
  echo "  Customer Impact: ${customer_impact}"
  echo ""
  echo "✅ Incident validation completed successfully"
else
  echo "❌ Validation failed. Missing parameters: ${MISSING_PARAMS}"
  echo "⚠️ Continuing workflow to handle validation failure..."
fi

steps.name: normalize-channel-name
steps.description: Normalize the channel name by replacing spaces with underscores and converting to lower case
steps.command:
echo 'ðŸ“ NORMALIZING SLACK CHANNEL NAME'
echo 'Original: ${slack_channel_id}'

# Start with the original channel name
NORMALIZED="${slack_channel_id}"

# Ensure it starts with # if not already
if [[ "$NORMALIZED" != \#* ]]; then
  NORMALIZED="#$NORMALIZED"
fi

# Convert to lowercase first
NORMALIZED=$(echo "$NORMALIZED" | tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]')

# Replace spaces with underscores
NORMALIZED=$(echo "$NORMALIZED" | sed 's/ /_/g')

# Replace any other special characters (except # - _) with underscores
NORMALIZED=$(echo "$NORMALIZED" | sed 's/[^a-z0-9#_-]/_/g')

# Remove multiple consecutive underscores
NORMALIZED=$(echo "$NORMALIZED" | sed 's/_\+/_/g')

# Remove leading/trailing underscores (but keep the #)
NORMALIZED=$(echo "$NORMALIZED" | sed 's/#_/#/' | sed 's/_$//')

# Ensure channel name is not too long (Slack limit is 80 chars)
if [ ${#NORMALIZED} -gt 80 ]; then
  NORMALIZED=${NORMALIZED:0:80}
fi

echo "Normalized: $NORMALIZED"
# Output only the normalized channel name for other steps to use
echo "$NORMALIZED" > /tmp/normalized_channel
echo "$NORMALIZED"

steps.name: notify-investigation-progress
steps.command:
echo 'INVESTIGATION PROGRESS - ONLY POST WHEN AGENTS START'
echo '==================================================='

# Post progress notification for LLM-classified agent investigation
echo "Classified agent: ${classified_agent}"
echo 'Investigation starting with AI-selected agent'

# Check if we have Slack token
if [ -z "${slack_token}" ] || [ "${slack_token}" = "null" ] || [ "${slack_token}" = "" ]; then
  echo 'No Slack token available - skipping progress notification'
  exit 0
fi

echo "Posting to channel: ${NORMALIZED_CHANNEL_NAME}"

# Simple progress message
PAYLOAD='{"channel":"'${NORMALIZED_CHANNEL_NAME}'","text":"ðŸ” AI Investigation Started","blocks":[{"type":"section","text":{"type":"mrkdwn","text":"ðŸ” *AI Investigation Started*\n'${incident_title}'"}}]}'

echo 'Posting progress to Slack...'
RESPONSE=$(curl -s -X POST https://slack.com/api/chat.postMessage \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer ${slack_token.token}" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d "${PAYLOAD}")

echo "Slack Response: ${RESPONSE}"

if echo "${RESPONSE}" | grep -q '"ok":true'; then
  echo 'Investigation progress posted to Slack'
else
  echo 'Investigation progress posting failed'
fi
steps.description: Post investigation progress update AFTER agents start

steps.name: prepare-investigation-instructions
steps.description: Prepare detailed investigation instructions for the agent
steps.command:
cat << 'EOF'
ðŸš¨ PRODUCTION INCIDENT INVESTIGATION - ${region_name}

**INCIDENT DETAILS:**
- **Public ID:** ${incident_id}
- **Title:** ${incident_title}
- **Severity:** ${incident_severity}
- **Priority:** ${incident_priority}
- **Customer Impact:** ${customer_impact}
- **Affected Services:** ${affected_services}

**INVESTIGATION CHECKLIST:**

### 1. CLUSTER HEALTH & NODES
kubectl get nodes -o wide
kubectl describe nodes | grep -E "Conditions|Capacity|Allocatable"
kubectl top nodes
kubectl get events --sort-by='.lastTimestamp' | tail -20

### 2. POD STATUS & HEALTH
kubectl get pods --all-namespaces -o wide | grep -v Running | head -20
kubectl get pods -n production -o wide | grep -E "Error|CrashLoop|Pending|Failed"
kubectl describe pods -n production | grep -E "Warning|Error|Failed" | head -30
kubectl top pods -n production --sort-by=cpu | head -10

### 3. SERVICE DISCOVERY & NETWORKING
kubectl get svc --all-namespaces
kubectl get ingress --all-namespaces
kubectl get endpoints --all-namespaces | grep -v "<none>"
nslookup kubernetes.default.svc.cluster.local

### 4. APPLICATION SPECIFIC CHECKS
kubectl logs deployment/${affected_services} -n production --tail=50 | grep -E "ERROR|WARN|FATAL|Exception"
kubectl describe deployment ${affected_services} -n production | grep -E "Warning|Error|Failed|Ready"
kubectl get hpa,pdb -n production | grep ${affected_services}
kubectl exec deployment/${affected_services} -n production -- curl -s localhost:8080/health | head -10

### 5. RESOURCE UTILIZATION
kubectl top pods -n production --containers
kubectl describe limits -n production
kubectl get pvc -n production -o wide
df -h

**INVESTIGATION REQUEST:**
Please conduct a thorough investigation of this ${incident_severity} severity incident affecting ${affected_services}. Provide detailed analysis, root cause identification, and actionable remediation steps.
EOF
